meanings.definition: To put a muzzle on (an animal)
meanings.sent1: The farmer needed to bemuzzle the loud dog to keep it from barking.
meanings.sent2: She decided to bemuzzle her pet rabbit to prevent it from chewing on the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat bemuzzled the unsuspecting mouse, making it impossible for it to squeak.
meanings.sent4: The forest ranger had to bemuzzle the bear to ensure the safety of the campers.
meanings.sent5: The trainer gently bemuzzled the horse before the show to keep it calm.

meanings.sent1: The teacher had to bemuzzle the noisy students during the exam.
meanings.sent2: The dictator tried to bemuzzle the protestors by banning public gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian bemuzzled the audience with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her loud laughter bemuzzled the entire library, causing everyone to stare.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules bemuzzle any form of dissent in the organization.
